original_title: 24 coastal areas identified as new tourist attractions
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st) – State Minister of Urban Development and Housing Arundika Fernando says that 24 coastal areas have been identified as tourist attractions in Sri Lanka.
The State Minister says that a decision has been made to hand over these tourist attractions to investors under temporary constructions so that they could contribute to the country's economy.
State Minister Arundika Fernando made this statement at a press conference held at the Presidential Media Center.
He also stated that upon the instructions of the President, measures have already been taken to develop Colombo, Ella, Nuwara Eliya, Kandy, and Trincomalee as tourist attraction areas.
Special Gazette notification declaring public and bank holidays in 2024
